intro: Indigofera byobiensis, commonly known as the Byobiensis legume, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, particularly India and Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces elongated pods containing small, dark seeds. Indigofera byobiensis is often grown for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in herbal medicine.
